id.description: The ID of the interface configuration

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the interface configuration

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the network interface

id.description: The ID of the interface configuration

mode.description: Network mode on which router will operate

ipaddr.description: IPv4 address. Your router's address on the network

netmask.description: IPv4 netmask. Netmask defines how 'large' a network is

gateway.description: IPv4 gateway. The address where the router will send all the outgoing traffic

broadcast.description: IPv4 broadcast. IP broadcasts are used by BOOTP and DHCP clients to find and send requests to their respective servers

broadcast_dhcp.description: Use broadcast flag. Required for certain ISPs, e.g. Charter with DOCSIS3.

auth.description: Authentication Type. Authentication method that your GSM carrier uses to authenticate new connections on it's network

username.description: Username. Your username that you would use to connect to your GSM carrier's network

password.description: Password. Your password that you would use to connect to your GSM carrier's network

service.description: Service Name. Leave empty to autodetect

x-web.pretty: Hostname to send when requesting DHCP

hostname.description: Hostname to send when requesting DHCP

pdptype.description: PDP type. Specifies what type of address is requested from the operator.

modem.description: Modem. Specify which modem to use for connection

sim.description: Specify which SIM card to use for connection

auto_apn.description: Auto APN. Auto APN scans an internal Android APN database and selects an APN based on the SIM card's operator and country. If the first automatically specified APN doesn\'t work, it attempts to use the next existing APN from the database

apn.description: APN ID (you can check available ID's in interface.status.data.apn_list array). APN (Access Point Name) is configurable network identifier used by a mobile device when connecting to a carrier.

leasetime.description: Lease time. Expiry time of leased address. Allowed characters: positive number followed by 'h', 'm' or 's' symbol.

force_link.description: Force link. Set interface properties regardless of the link carrier (If set, carrier sense events do not invoke hotplug handlers).

defaultroute.description: Use default gateway. If '0', no default route is configured

metric.description: Use gateway metric. The configuration by default generates a routing table entry. In this field you can alter the metric of that entry. Lower metric means higher priority.

ip6prefix.description: IPv6 routed prefix. Public prefix routed to this device for distribution to clients

x-web.pretty: Client ID to send when requesting DHCP

clientid.description: Client ID to send when requesting DHCP. Client ID which will be sent when requesting a DHCP lease

x-web.pretty: Vendor class to send when requesting DHCP

vendorid.description: Vendor Class to send when requesting DHCP. Vendor class which will be sent when requesting a DHCP lease

keepalive_failure.description: LCP echo failure threshold. Presume peer to be dead after given amount of LCP echo failures, use 0 to ignore failures

keepalive_interval.description: LCP echo interval. Send LCP echo requests at the given interval in seconds, only effective in conjunction with failure threshold

host_uniq.description: Host-Uniq tag content. Raw hex-encoded bytes. Leave empty unless your ISP require this

demand.description: Inactivity timeout. Close inactive connection after the given amount of seconds, use 0 to persist connection

mac.description: MAC address. Used in mobile passthrough or bridge mode

macaddr.description: Override MAC address of the interface. For example, your ISP (Internet Service Provider) gives you a static IP address and it might also bind it to your computers MAC address (i.e., that IP will only work with your computer but not with your router). In this field you can select your computer’s MAC address and fool the gateway in to thinking that it is communicating with your computer. You can select the MAC address of a currently connected computer, or use a custom one. When changing MAC address on LAN interface be careful to avoid MAC address collisions

mtu.description: Override MTU. Maximum Transmission Unit (MTU) – specifies the largest possible size of a data packet.

ip4table.description: IP4table. IPv4 routing table for routes of this interface

ip6table.description: IP6table. IPv6 routing table for routes of this interface

ip6assign.description: IPv6 assignment length. Assign a part of given length of every public IPv6

ip6hint.description: IPv6 assignment hint. Assign prefix parts using this hexadecimal subprefix ID for this interface

ip6addr.description: IPv6 address. Assigns an IPv6 address for this interface. CIDR notation: address/prefix

ip6ifaceid.description: IPv6 suffix. Optional. Allowed values: 'eui64', 'random', fixed value like '::1' or '::1:2'. When IPv6 prefix (like 'a:b:c:d::') is received from a delegating server, use the suffix (like '::1') to form the IPv6 address ('a:b:c:d::1') for the interface

bridge.description: Bridge interfaces. Creates a bridge over specified interface(s)

stp.description: Enable STP. Enables the Spanning Tree Protocol on this bridge

igmp_snooping.description: Enable IGMP. Enables IGMP snooping on this bridge

ifname.description: List of physical interface names to assign to this configuration (only 1 if bridge is turned off)

fiber_priority.description: Port priority. Port priority option allows to change physical port priority (SFP or Ethernet). This option is uniform between all eth1 interfaces.

fwzone.description: Choose the firewall zone you want to assign to this interface. Pass "" to remove the interface from the associated zone or define a new zone and attach the interface to it.

p2p.description: Use p2p method for setting subnet instead of auto.

mode.description: Network mode on which router will operate

ipaddr.description: IPv4 address. Your router's address on the network

netmask.description: IPv4 netmask. Netmask defines how 'large' a network is

gateway.description: IPv4 gateway. The address where the router will send all the outgoing traffic

broadcast.description: IPv4 broadcast. IP broadcasts are used by BOOTP and DHCP clients to find and send requests to their respective servers

broadcast_dhcp.description: Use broadcast flag. Required for certain ISPs, e.g. Charter with DOCSIS3.

auth.description: Authentication Type. Authentication method that your GSM carrier uses to authenticate new connections on it's network

username.description: Username. Your username that you would use to connect to your GSM carrier's network

password.description: Password. Your password that you would use to connect to your GSM carrier's network

service.description: Service Name. Leave empty to autodetect
